titleStmt.title: IN GOGEI AEDITIONEM, G. Chatertoni carmen Eligiacum, Christi Collegij Cantabrigi Socij, ad Lectorem.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: IN GOGEI AEDITIONEM, G. Chatertoni carmen Eligiacum, Christi Collegij Cantabrigi Socij, ad Lectorem.

monogr.title: The zodiake of life written by the godly and zealous poet Marcellus Pallingenius stellatus [sic], wherein are conteyned twelue bookes disclosing the haynous crymes [and] wicked vices of our corrupt nature: and plainlye declaring the pleasaunt and perfit pathway vnto eternal lyfe, besides a numbre of digressions both pleasaunt [and] profitable, newly translated into Englishe verse by Barnabæ Googe
monogr.author: Palingenio Stellato, Marcello

div.head: IN GOGEI AEDITIONEM, G. Chatertoni carmen Eligiacum, Christi Collegij Cantabrigi • Socij, ad Lectorem.

lg.l: Marmoreae turres, praecinctae maenibus vrbes
Tempore labenti, praecipitata ruunt.
Intereunt statuae, monumenta antiqua virorum
Quicquid & orbis habet, tempore cassa iacēt
Vrbs Romana licet, sublimibus alta columnis:
Occidet horrendi conscia dedecoris.
Magnificam paenis videas, Carthaginis vrbem:
Nulla loci, aut vrbis pristina signa manent.
Sempiterna manent, quae scripsit carmina Gogus
Aetnaeis nunq praeda voranda rogis.
Non opus egregium hoc, himnis celebrare decorū est
Hoc erit in toto notius orbe nihil.
Te tamen inprimis nostra haec mirabitur • tas
Si moriere, tuum non morietur opus.
Anglia laetatur se tali prole parentem,
Est{que} sibi solum, se genuisse satis.
Haec antiqua domus (tibi quōdā se dula nutrix)
Extulit ad verbum, nominis ecce caput
Quos et hebraea min vel quos nec greca iuuabūt
Cui{que} minus forsan turba latina placet.
Huc omnes populi, vos huc generosa iuuen •• s
Confluite huc pueri, decrepiti{que} senes.
